lines.text: Come see me in the Casbah!
lines.character: Lola de Castro de la Fuente de Espramadura 'La Belle Abbesse'

lines.text: I was down in the dumps. But seeing her skip along the street was a revelation. Do you know what I'll give them?
No.

A taste of the low life for millionaires. Adventure in comfort. Garden tables, the best champagne, great numbers by the finest artistes. The bourgeois will be thrilled to mix with our girls without fear of disease or getting knifed.
Bon jour, Titi.
Bon jour, Thérèse. Bon Appétit.
Bon Appétit. Bon jour, Victor
Bon jour, madame.
Would you like to become a dancer, miss?
Everyone knows what that means.
She's my daughter.
I'm very interested in her, madame.
My daughter is an honest girl.
Ha-ha. I don't doubt it. What does she earn working for you?
She's not for sale.
I want to give her a career.
She already has one. What kind of career?
The finest of all, dear lady. The theater.
It's expected among theater people. You have to do it or you get nowhere. That's what bothers me.
If I were in your shoes...
I always dreamed that Paulo would be the first. I'm afraid of looking foolish with Danglard.
You've still got time to take a lesson before tonight.
Listen to you!
[Nini runs to the Boulangerie. Enters. Locks the door. Sneaks up to Paolo]
Nini!
Where's your uncle?
Asleep upstairs.
[Nini seductively walks into the back store room. Paulo follows]
I welcome you always, O unknown lady, la-la-la-la-la, la-la-la
You want to put me in a cage like a canary? I warn you, it won't last long.
Do I look like Prince Charming? Only one thing matters to me - what I create.
In the end, you think it matters what you and I want? All that counts is what they want. We're at the service of the public.

You know why it breaks my heart to see you go? They can smash the place to pieces for all I care! But the profession's losing a good trouper. I thought you were one of us. If not, get out! Line up for the quadrille, girls.
I was born at Sidi Bel Abbes in the land of beautiful women...
lines.character: Lola de Castro de la Fuente de Espramadura 'La Belle Abbesse'
